title: christmas shoppers face festive travel
story: Christmas shoppers face festive travel chaos as train drivers vote to strikeThousands of Christmas shoppers and commuters could see their journeys disrupteda UK rail union takes industrial action over the upcoming festive periodChristmas shoppers could face travel chaos in London Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsChristmas shoppers could face mayhem travelling in London with strike action being planned that could affect the festive period. Nearly  per cent of Tube drivers are backing a walk out due to anger over possible reductions to their pensions and changes to working conditions put forward by Transport for London . Members of rail union Aslef are now considering taking industrial action over the busy Christmas period. The huge number of tube drivers wanting to go out on strike is as a result of them feeling that the “agreed working conditions” are now being torn up.Finn Brennan, Aslef’s organiser on the Underground, said the vote was extraordinary, reported MyLondon.  He added: Itaposs a staggering mandate from our members that sends a clear message to Transport for London. Government cuts to its funding, together with a fall in passenger numbers since the Covid pandemic, have led to a financial crisis at TfL. Management and government now want to plug that funding gap by slashing staff pensions and tearing up our agreed working conditions. “This ballot result shows that our Tube train drivers aren’t prepared to let them get away with it.” So far no date has been put in place for a strike but Aslef is considering the Christmas period to put more pressure on the TfL. A fresh bailout is being sought by the TfL from central government with further talks on December . The service saw its cash from travel fares dry up during the pandemic - leading to hundreds of millions of pounds in lost revenue. Central government gave the TfL a series of short-term funding deals with conditions including a review of pensions and moves towards driverless trains, reported MyLondon. With no more funding for London transport in the government’s recent Comprehensive Spending Review, it has led to fears of more cuts. London Underground management is currently reviewing “every aspect” of the business, meaning it could be heading towards strikes on the network. Nearly , tube drivers voted in the ballot and just  drivers voted against strike action.Mick Whelan, general secretary of ASLEF, said: “Last year Boris Johnson stood on the steps of Downing Street and applauded essential workers. Now his government wants to cut our pensions and attack our working conditions.”“It’s up to Boris Johnson to step up and do the right thing to help keep the capital moving. Last year, the basic salary for a full time underground driver was £, and there are no plans yet to ballot overground drivers, reported MyLondon. A Transport for London spokesperson said: “This mandate relates to ongoing discussions with our trade unions. We urge ASLEF to continue working with us to resolve these matters without having to resort to industrial action. title: covid conspiracy theorist confronts one
story: Covid conspiracy theorist confronts one of UKs sickest patients in hospitalAndrew Watts, from Bexley, south London, nearly had his ventilator switched off after he was admitted to Queen Elizabeth Hospital with Covid- pneumoniaAndy Watts underwent months of treatment after falling illByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA dad-of-two described by doctors as aposone of the sickest Covid patients we’ve ever seenapos said he was confronted by a conspiracy theorist during his -month ordeal. Andrew Watts, from Bexley, south London, nearly had his ventilator switched off after he was admitted to Queen Elizabeth Hospital with Covid- pneumonia. The -year-old black cab driver fell ill on Christmas Day  and ended up being one of the longest patient stays the hospital in Woolwich has seen. He spent eight months in intensive care and then two months on a ward which adds up to  days in total. In a new interview he has revealed that he was confronted by a conspiracy theorist and some visitors in his hospital ward believed the virus was a aposhoaxapos despite his gruelling ordeal.  Sky News reports that he said he was confronted by one person visiting another patient who told him the virus was all a conspiracy.He said: There were people in the hospital in the ward I was in, who were visiting certain patients, who didnapost believe it. There were people who didnapost believe in the vaccination for a start, then there were people who didnapost believe Covid was real.@ Andrew said he brushed it aside and didnapost want to get into arguments with them.  He added: In the end, I just thought: aposHereaposs the proof -you donapost want to believe it, what can I do apos After a five-week induced coma and a le-threatening lung collapse, Andrewaposs health deteriorated to such an extent that in February, doctors called his family to tell them they were considering turning his ventilator off. Recalling when he first became unwell, Andrew said: A week before Christmas , I started to feel ill. “I wasn’t eating and I was losing weight, but I thought it was just the anxiety getting to me. When I was admitted to hospital with Covid I initially responded well to treatment, but then my oxygen levels started to drop and I was taken for a CT scan. That was when I was told that I had a pneuomothorax, which is a split on the lung. “I was on my own as this was the height of Covid, with no visitors allowed, so it was a lot to take in. By this point I was crying my eyes out, on the phone to my sister Hannah and my we Hayley, but I didn’t want to tell my mum or my dad. I couldn’t bring myself to tell them.” After overcoming a second lung collapse, fortunately, Andrew’s lungs begun to improve and he was able to come off the ventilator in June . Andrew’s family, including his we Hayley and sons Jack, six, and Joshua, three, were able to visit, although he could only communicate by pointing a stick at letters on a board. title: entirely vegan fish chip shop
story: Entirely vegan fish and chip shop launches - and even meat eaters have given the thumbs upThe owner says the reaction to the slightly unusual takeaway business in Levenshulme, Manchester, has been ‘brilliant’Even meat eaters have given the chippy their seal of approval Image: @jjsvishandchipsmanchester on InstagramByGeorgie Hughes:,  Nov | commentsA new fish and chip shop has opened in Manchester, with a signicant dference. It isn’t any old takeaway, as all the food served is plant-based and vegan. The Levenshulme business, JJ’s Vish and Chips, which opened its doors earlier this month, aims to be a plant-based offering for both vegans and meat eaters who want to try something new. It offers vegan fish and chips, as well as vegan bratwurst, sausage and nuggets, so no-one has to feel left out when they’re looking for a takeaway. JJ’s Vish and Chips began serving Manchester in February as a takeaway business, with plans to open a shop when the time was right. Owner Jess Jones, , from Leeds,told our sister site Chill: “It was about two and a half, nearly three years ago now, I was at a fish and chip shop in Leeds, my hometown, and just wanted a takeaway.“I was vegetarian at the time and realised I couldn’t get anything that was vegetarian and a chippy tea. “There were all these sort of things that were coming out like vegan burgers and junk food you could get, but there didn’t seem to be any fish and chip shop replicas.” With that in mind, Ms Jones decided to go out and create her own version of fish and chips that vegetarians and vegans could enjoy.Wondering where to eat, drink or visit for your next UK holiday  At Chill we help you decide where to go and stay next with hundreds of recommendations right on your doorstep. Visit our brilliant new website chill and start packing. If youaposd also like weekly inspiration and advice for your next trip, you can sign up to the Chill newsletter here. For the latest must-have travel news follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter. She said: “It was just a case of me feeling like I was missing out and I came up with this mad idea.” Ms Jones uses banana blossom to make the vish which is then shaped into fish-shaped patties, marinated in fishy flavours, battered and fried. It took a bit of experimentation to decide on this recipe, but Ms Jones was armed with some culinary knowledge when she first embarked on the venture.  Ms Jones said: “I worked in hospitality for many years and I’ve worked in kitchens, so I enjoy cooking a lot. “So to come up with the recipe it was a mix of my knowledge from working in kitchens, trying things at home, reading online and trial and error really.” Ms Jones opened her first shop in Leeds in  and has received a lot of support from Mancunians since the opening of her new site. She said: “The reaction has been brilliant, since opening our Manchester site it’s been absolutely mental. “We’ve had lots of excited people in the shop and nice stuff online. It’s really nice and positive so far.” Many people choose to eat plant-based food, claiming a vegan or vegetarian diet can help to protect the planet.  Some people are reluctant to make the switch because they don’t want to give up their favourite dishes that contain meat or fish. At JJ’s Vish and Chips, vegans and non-vegans alike enjoy the plant-based recreation of the fish and chips which is important to Ms Jones, as she wants everyone to enjoy her food. She said: “I’ve read a few comments online that have said, ‘Iaposm a meat eater and I can confirm it’s nice’. “I think because there’s been quite a lot of hype it might have encouraged people who might not have tried before to just give it a go which is really important. “I don’t want to just cater to vegans and veggies, I want to cater to everyone and anyone. “If someone can come to the shop and have my chippy tea over a fish chippy tea every now and again then I feel like that’s me doing my bit for the planet.” Comment MORE ON ChillFoodFast foodJunk food" data-immediate"data-immediate"Fancy an escape to the Chill newsletter for weekly inspiration and advice on UK holidays Sign Up!Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news hard-nails-caver-joked-pals-"Rescuers pull man from cave and send him to hospitalByWilliam WalkerNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsFriends of the caver who was freed after the UKaposs biggest ever cave rescue have praised the aposhard as nailsapos survivor and good humour following his rescue. George Linnane, who describes himself on social media as a “petrolhead, scuba er, caver, engineer, snowboarder, DJ, producer, human”, became trapped in the Ogof Ffynnon Ddu caves in the Brecon Beacons, Wales. The rescue lasting more than  hours involved  personnel and was Britainaposs biggest ever cave rescue. To get him out, rescuers had to swim through a swollen underground stream, with George on a floating stretcher, and had to lt him ft through a vertical chasm with the stretcher on ropes. HE couldnapost avoid some good-natured ribbing as he was carried out.  Michael Thomas, a friend and fellow caver who spent  hours underground with George, joked online: “The first thing he got from me… was stick, making me go down bloody dim [water] entrance to reach him.” His mum, Sally Linnane-Hemmens, said the long wait for her son to be brought to the surface had been “horrendous”. Sally, from Titchfield, Hants, set up a fundraiser for the South  Mid-Wales Cave Rescue Team which led the operation. The Times reports that following the rescue a friend said he was experienced, known for being a reliable caver, and aposhard as nails.apos “He doesn’t take risks,” they said. “Throughout the rescue George was very stoic that’s the kind of person he is. He’s got a huge amount of experience in cave exploration and has qualied as an underground er as well.” And friends said he was aposlaughingapos at jokes made via social media about his rescue. His girlfriend, who asked not to be named, was reported to have said she was grateful to the rescuers.  Meanwhile, in an interview with the , Dr Brendan Sloan, a consultant in anaesthetics and intensive care for Mid-Yorkshire Hospitals NHS Trust who spent hours below ground assisting the caver, called him aposremarkably resilient.aposHe said: “He was conscious for the whole rescue, talking to us, responding to our questions. “He was clearly anxious and keen to get out of there, but he was remarkably resilient and co-operative, which made it a lot easier. It required some very dficult manoeuvring for the stretcher for a very long period and he was in quite a lot of pain throughout.” Dr Sloan, who is also a member of the South and Mid Wales Cave Rescue Team, added that he was aposan experienced caver who was simply unluckyapos saying: “It could have happened to any of us. title: human remains found garden 20
story: Human remains found in garden  miles from Fred and Rose West house of horrorsThe scene where the remains were found is currently unfolding in Kemble, in Gloucestershire, and has sparked frantic anxiety among local neighbours and residents due to its proximity to the Wests homeA police forensic tent is seen where human remains were found in Kemble Image: Daniel Webb   SWNSByJames RodgerRegional Content Editor:,  Nov | commentsHuman remains have been discovered in a garden being dug up by builders just  miles away from the Rose and Fred West aposhouse of horrors.aposThe sick couple from Gloucester were arrested for the murder of  women and girls in .Fred killed himself while on remand in prison and Rose went on to be convicted of  of the brutal murders.She is one of the few murderers in the UK who will die in prison after she was handed down a whole-le sentence.The scene where the remains were found is currently unfolding in Kemble, in Gloucestershire, as forensic tents are erected. Do you live on the street where the human reminds have been found  Email webnews@mirror  The gruesome find has sparked frantic anxiety among local neighbours and residents due to its proximity to the Westaposs home in Cromwell Street, Gloucester. One resident told news agency SWNS: I didnapost even know it was happening until other parents were talking about it on the playground this morning. I think the reason for the crime scene is being kept very quiet at the moment. Whenever thereaposs a big crime scene in Gloucestershire, everybody thinks about Fred and Rose [West].  Aerial photographs have been pictured on November  and have been circulating online ever since, as attention is drawn to the developing story. The witness then continued, saying: Obviously thereaposs nothing to say it is one of their victims, but who knows how many there were and where they could be hidden. Gloucestershire Constabulary has confirmed human bones were found on site but said it was not in a position to state where they came from or who they belonged to. A spokesperson said: Police received a report that human bones were discovered by a builder working at a property in Kemble last Thursday .  Officers remain at the scene and inquiries are continuing. Fred and Rose tortured and killed an unknown number of girls and women over a -year period. Their victims include Fredaposs daughter Charmaine, eight, in , and the coupleaposs daughter Heather, , in . Fred is said to have confessed to more murders - taking his morbid total to  - while on remand before he committed suicide. news uk-news huntswoman-who-kicked-horse-shocking-"Hertfordshire: Horse kicked and punched by riderBySimon HamalienkoChiara Fiorillo:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments A huntswoman who kicked a horse in a shocking video is a primary school teacher and a mum of two, it has been reported. Sarah Moulds, , was filmed apparently kicking and punching a distressed horse in the street.A clip shared on social media by anti-hunting campaign group Hertfordshire Hunt Saboteurs shows her being aggressive towards the animal after it ran into a road. The sickening footage quickly caused outrage on social media, with people calling on the RSPCA - the largest animal welfare charity in the UK - to launch an investigation. Today, it has been reported that Ms Moulds is a married teacher and mum who works at Somerby Primary School and is also a director of the Knossington  Somerby Pre-School in Leicestershire. The Daily Star reports that Moulds was listed as a team manager for the local Cottesmore Pony Club but has since been removed from the website following the allegations.The Pony Club has now confirmed that Moulds was never a member and has been removed from her voluntary position.  A spokesperson for the Pony Club said: We are aware of the video circulating showing unacceptable treatment of a pony and we wholeheartedly condemn this behaviour. The welfare of horses and ponies is of the utmost importance to The Pony Club, therefore the lady in question has been removed from her voluntary position as a team organiser for a branch.  The Pony Club is a youth membership organisation and as such, she is not a member of The Pony Club. Cottesmore Hunt, who Moulds is believed to be part of, yesterday told The Mirror: The Chairman and Masters want to make it quite clear that they strongly disapprove of any such actions and assure you that they take a matter such as this very seriously and will deal with it in an appropriate manner.  The Hunting Office also criticised the footage, saying in a statement: The Hunting Office expects the highest level of animal welfare at all times - both on and off the hunting field - and condemns the actions taken by this inidual, who is not a member of the hunting associations. The RSPCA did not confirm the identity of the hunt rider but said in a statement: This footage is really upsetting.  We will always look into complaints made to us about animal welfare. We would urge anyone with first hand information about this incident to contact us on   . Knossington  Somerby Pre-School in Leicestershire declined to comment on the story. The Mirror has contacted Somerby Primary School for comment. title: im dating three women time
story: Exclusive: Im dating three women at a time, we practice safe sex and coordinate our calendarsRoy Graff, , from London, agrees with Danny Dyer about marriage and says some of us have the capacity to love more than one person at a time...it can feel cruel to have to exclude others they want to connect withRoy Graff has multiple relationships Image: InstagramByClaire OBoyle:,  Nov | commentsRoy Graff has been in polyamorous - meaning more than one partner - relationships for  years. The -year-old, from London, has two long-term relationships and is currently dating three women on a casual basis. “I don’t have a primary relationship where I live with someone,” says Roy, “but I have multiple relationships which I practice in parallel. Along with my partners, we practice lots of transparency and honesty. They know who  I’m dating and we all make sure to practice safe sex - and also to coordinate our calendars.” When it comes to logistics Roy, who began working as a relationship coach last year after a career in digital marketing, says he spends time dferently depending on which partner he’s with.What is your view on polyamory  Have your say in the comment section “One of them doesn’t have any other partners, while the other has a few casual connections. I see one of the women every week to  days and the other I’ll see a few times week. When it comes to the more casual date we’ll go for drinks or just stay the night with each other. As long as everyone knows where they stand then it’s a good approach.” And while Roy, and his two long-term partners, both of whom he has been seeing for around three years, normally live separately, they decided to live together during lockdown. “We were worried about not being able to see each other,” he explains. “It wasn’t easy as we didn’t have much space or privacy and we’re all used to living on our own, but it worked for around six or eight weeks.  The key is to be really aware of what your real needs are in a relationship. The way I see it, I don’t own anyone’s body, mind or emotions. Just because we’re dating they’re not obliged to give me their time or affection. I would spend two nights a week with each one, have a couple of nights to myself and then we’d get together one night to watch a film or something like that. We’re all quite independent and like our own space, so it was nice to get that back later on.”  Roy, who runs website openrelating.love, has been married in the past but thinks it’s unlikely he’ll wed again - because he thinks like Danny Dyer. “For me it didn’t feel right,” he says. “The structures just didn’t work for me and I wasn’t comfortable with the idea there was only this one person I was going to spend time with. I believe some of us have the capacity to love more than one person at a time and for people like that it can feel cruel to have to exclude others they want to connect with.” Comment MORE ON Danny DyerLoveDatingMarriageRelationships" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news inside-squalid-rat-infested-home-"Tenants from hell leave house in squalid conditionByJake BrigstockLorraine King:,  Nov | commentsAn elderly man was found to be living in a squalid rat-infested home which was so filthy it posed a risk to his le.The shocking discovery was made by Ashfield District Councilaposs environment health team after they were made aware of a resident living in appalling conditions in a privately-owned property in the Selston area of Nottingham. The emergency inspection of the house found the resident living alongside a large infestation of rats with no electricity, heating or water. The property was also in such a serious state of disrepair that it could have collapsed at any moment, Nottinghamshire Live reports.Concerned council officers moved the elderly resident into a local care home due to his ill health.  John Wilmott, cabinet member for licensing at Ashfield District Council, said: The owner of the property was vulnerable and living in an awful condition that could have ended his le. The amount of filth in the property was unimaginable, it was truly unbelievable that someone could live that way, but thanks to the work of our officers, he never has to live like that again. The council is committed to supporting vulnerable residents and utilising all available resources to ensure the empty and dangerous homes are made safe and reoccupied.  The environmental health team helped the owner sell his house at auction which has now been renovated into a family home. Last month a frustrated landlord spoke of his experiences with nightmare tenants who left his properties in squalid conditions. The man has been renting out houses for  years and despite building up a successful business, he constantly has to deal with tenants who wreck his homes and live in filth.  The homeowner, who has houses in Grimsby and Cleethorpes, Lincolnshire, said he once saw a baby crawl through dog poo in one of their flats.On another occasion, he visited a house and found a lawnmower in the living room, Grimsby Live reports.The landlord said he is now on his tenth eviction, which has taken a financial toll on his family. For this reason, they have decided to start selling their houses instead of renting them. title: liverpool fan 8 cried himself
story: Liverpool fan, , cried himself to sleep after being refused entry to matchFootball loving Campbell Kaplinsky, eight, had been dreaming of going to see Liverpool FC for the first time before his dad bought two tickets for the West Ham game on November Campbell Kaplinsky, eight, cried himself to sleep after the tickets were taken awayByAbigail Nicholson:,  Nov | commentsAn eight-year-old Liverpool fan was left aposinconsolableapos and in floods of tears after being refused entry to a football match. Football loving Campbell Kaplinsky, eight, had been dreaming of going to see Liverpool FC for the first time before his dad bought two tickets for the West Ham game on November . Dad Ben, bought the tickets for his son as a reward for going to bed on time for three weeks and claims he didnapost know they were for the home end until being told by officials.Ben told The ECHO: He was so excited he wanted to arrive at the train station more than  minutes before the train arrived.He woke up at .am full of excitement and spoke about nothing but the match all day.  The dad and son travelled two and a half hours from Brighton to the Olympic Stadium, with Campbell wearing a red Liverpool shirt under his camo jacket. Ben struggled to keep up with his son as he ran excitedly from Stratford Station to the stadium gates. But once outside Gate C officials took the pairaposs tickets away and Campbell was left aposinconsolableapos. His dad said: I could not believe it as the officials disappeared with the tickets and suspected they may have been sold on for personal profit. The poor boy was inconsolable, locked out the stadium as the best day of his le turned into the worst day of his le. As he went to sleep that night sobbing I did my best to comfort him by reminding him of that timeless Liverpool anthem of strength, hope and resilience – aposthough your dreams be tossed and blown at the end of the storm there is a golden sky and you will never walk aloneapos. West Ham says that home match tickets are for the use by West Ham supporters only. Anyone applying for or using home match tickets must be a supporter of West Ham and not a supporter of the visiting club. The club also says that any inidual who enters any part of London Stadium designated for the use of any group of supporters to which they do not belong may be ejected from the ground either for the purposes of their own safety or for any other reason. The club states that any supporter who purchases tickets must acknowledge acceptance of this and all other terms and conditions, including ground regulations. title: malala yousafzai gets married 10
story: Malala Yousafzai gets married  years after surviving being shot in the head by TalibanThe youngest ever Nobel Peace Prize Laureate Malala Yousafzai, , has shared pictures of her gazing fondly at her new husband Asser Malik during their intimate marriage ceremony held at her Birmingham homeGirls education activist Malala Yousafzai has married during a small ceremony at home in Birmingham Image: malala.orgByRyan FaheyReporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsCelebrated girlsapos education activist Malala Yousafzai has marked a precious day as she tied the knot with her new husband.Nobel Peace Prize winner Malala, , posted a series of pictures on Twitter showing the Islamic marriage ceremony with Asser Malik, who she called her partner for le.The Taliban gun attack survivor is seen dressed in a melon-pink gown with gold lining as she gazes lovingly at her new husband. Other snaps show the couple signing contracts and beaming as they sit between Malalaaposs parents Ziauddin Yousafzai and Toor Pekai Yousafzai. On Twitter she wrote: Today marks a precious day in my le. Asser and I tied the knot to be partners for le.We celebrated a small nikkah ceremony at home in Birmingham with our families. Please send us your prayers. We are excited to walk together for the journey ahead. Just a few months ago in June, Malala dissected the system of marriage for young Pakistani women in an interview with Vogue. I still donapost understand why people have to get married. If you want to have a person in your le, why do you have to sign marriage papers, why canapost it just be a partnership  she said. Her comment was in relation to a conversation she had with her mum, who wanted her to get married because marriage is beautul. Malalaaposs comments sparked outrage, with commenters calling her un-Islamic and a bane to society, Varsity reports. Her queries about the marriage bond even lead to death threats, with one cleric being arrested after saying he would carry out a suicide attack on the young woman when she visits Pakistan, tribune reports.Just months ago in June, the celebrated activist graduated after completing a degree at Oxford University. She posted a series of photos, including one of herself covered in colourful squares and a cream cake. Another showed her family posing with balloons and a large cake reading: Happy graduation Malala. She wrote: Hard to express my joy and gratitude right now as I completed my Philosophy, Politics and Economics degree at Oxford.I don’t know what’s ahead. For now, it will be Netflix, reading and sleep.Like many students this year Malala has graduated in unusual circumstances.  Universities across the country have closed to students and non-essential staff, meaning exams could not go ahead as usual. The typically raucous celebrations expected after an intense exam season have also not been able to go ahead, with graduates like Malala having to toast their successes at home instead. The human rights activist came to the worldaposs attention when she was  and a blog she had written about le as a girl in Taliban-controlled Swat Valley caught the eye of journalist Adam B. Ellick. The subsequent New York Times documentary gave Malala a  to speak about the suppression of girlsapos education in the region. Eight years ago a Taliban gunman attempted to assassinate her for her activism, plunging the then -year-old into a critical condition with a bullet to the head. She was transferred to a hospital in Birmingham, UK where she recovered before setting up a le in the country. Malala co-authored the best-selling book aposI am Malalaapos in  and jointly won the  Nobel Peace Prize along with Kailash Satyarthi. Hundreds of people flocked to wish the young woman well upon news of her graduation from Lady Margaret Hall.Astronaut and former USA national rugby player Anne McClain wrote: Congratulations on your graduation @Malala! For so many, higher education is the start of great things.For you, great things preceded it and I can only imagine the even greater ones to follow. The world is lucky to have you on it. Radio presenter Lauren Laverne said: Never been so happy to see someone covered in cake! Congratulations! : Author Philip Pullman added: Congratulations! title: man refused entry bar bouncers
story: Man refused entry into bar by bouncers because leopard print trousers were too muchBrandon Rogers, , who has autism, had visited  Stories yesterday to celebrate his sister’s birthday with cocktails in central ManchesterBrandon Rogers has accused  Stories of homophobic behaviour Image: Brandon Rogers   MEN MediaByAdam MaidmentLeonie Chao-Fong:,  Nov | commentsA gay man was refused entry to a restaurant in Manchester city centre after a bouncer reportedly said his leopard print trousers was “too, too much.” Brandon Rogers, , who has autism, had visited  Stories yesterday to celebrate his sister’s birthday with cocktails in central Manchester. But Brandon, from Cheadle Hulme, was the only one out of a party of six told he couldn’t enter the venue which advertises a smart-casual dress code.His sister Paris Osborne has called out the venue on Twitter, saying her brother was the victim of homophobic and discriminatory abuse, reports Manchester Evening News.She said: “Weaposve just been out for my sisteraposs birthday and my brother, who is the best dressed out of all of us and is extremely expressive and proudly gay, was denied entry to @storiesMCR. “The bouncer looked him up and down, said his apospants are too too muchapos, aposthe leopard print, no.apos “But then let a man who was seen as more male who wore jeans that were discoloured, dirty and wore worn out trainers, straight in. “Absolute discrimination and homophobic. This needs to be seriously addressed. DD London, which operates  Stories, apologised to Brandon and said the company operates on a ‘zero-discrimination policy’. But Brandon said he found the bounceraposs comments “infuriating” as he did not see a problem with the way he was dressed. He said: “When we arrived, my sister went into the building and askedthey had a table for six and the bouncer said yes. “When I walked up behind them, he looked me up and down three times and it felt like he was looking at me judgmentally. “The bouncer said everyone  could come in but there was an issue with what I was wearing. My dad asked why and he said what I was wearing was too casual, gesturing towards my pants. “We asked what the dress code was and he said it was smart casual. He said jeans were allowed but what I was wearing was apostoo, too muchapos. “Queer people are suppressed and made to feel dferent our entire lives. I’m personally not a very confident person so the way I present myself with dangly earrings and patterned clothing makes me feel that little bit more confident and happy within myself. “Having autism as well makes it really dficult for me to find ways to express myself and feel comfortable within my own skin, so businesses discriminating against me like this could potentially tear down all of that.” Following Paris’ original post, which has now been shared by hundreds of accounts, Brandon’s sister posted a photo from Instagram showing a number of women tagged at  Stories wearing similar leopard print clothes. “I don’t understand why me wearing leopard print pants doesn’t fit their dress code but they let women with the same print in,” Brandon added.  “It was clearly subconscious homophobia - something which I am used to. “My family were more angry at the situation than I was because I’m used to brushing off situations like this but we shouldn’t have to. “I’m sick of people having this rose-tinted view of the world being so much more equal and better now, but these high-end venues don’t cater to people like me because I’m not their target audience. “We need to get past the idea that male-presenting people wearing what is viewed as “feminine” clothing is detrimental to their reputation. Their policies are the problem.” Brandon, who is studying psychology at university, said the incident will not stop him from dressing the way he does but could have caused real hurt to others. If going out in animal print means that I get denied because it’s too much, then I will just go to a more queer-friendly space without the added toxic masculinity. “But there’s others who are in a fragile state where it could really be detrimental to them and affect their self-worth.” A spokesperson for DD London apologised to Brandon and said the company operates on a ‘zero-discrimination policy’. They said: “We would like to apologise to Brandon, Paris and their party for the upset this incident has caused and that the group were refused entry from  Stories.  “Since opening, we have implemented a dress code policy at  Stories. On this occasion, our door team, reception desk and manager did not believe that the dress code had been adhered to and made the decision to refuse entry. “We operate a zero-discrimination policy at  Stories and across DD London and have been doing a great deal of work to implement this by training and educating our staff across the group. “We have been working with the LGBT Foundation to develop a training programme for all DD employees which is now a standard as part of their ongoing training and development. “Some venues across the group have been trialling this programme, providing feedback to all management via focus groups and webinars ahead of the programme being rolled out to all  venues by the end of December. “Over the last year we have put a number of measures in place to improve awareness and processes and a great deal of work has taken place behind the scenes to ensure  Stories and other DD venues are inclusive for all with management training, our partnership with LGBT Foundation and the donation we have made over the last year to support the incredible work the foundation is doing. “Our external security team has gone through mandatory training in LGBTQ+, Effective Communication, and Mental Health Awareness, in the past year. “We have contacted Paris and her family in order to discuss this incident and we look forward to hearing back from them soon.” In a tweet, Dr Paul Martin OBE, CEO of LGBT Foundation, said: What’s happened to Brandon is disgraceful  @StoriesMCR need to apologise immediately and acknowledge that they got this very wrong. Whilst it’s true @LGBTfdn have begun working with them this incident has clearly highlighted that much more work needs to be done. news uk-news meghan-markle-calls-dislike-button-"Prince Harry and Meghan Markle relaunching social channelsByMilo BoydReporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle has called for a aposdislikeapos button to be introduced on Instagram.The Duchess of Sussex was speaking at the NYTDealbook Online Summit on Tuesday when she suggested the upgrade. The -year-old, who is currently living in her  million mansion in Calornia having stepped back from the royal family, spoke about womenaposs opportunities at work for the aposMinding the Gapapos event. She made the case alongside Mellody Hobson, President of Ariel Investments and the chairwoman of Starbucks Corporation. At one point the mum-of-two turned her attention to social media, suggesting that the current set up encouraged negative debate. The Duchess highlighted the fact that Instagram has a like button and ability to comment, but not a aposdislikeapos option.  As a consequence, people either express their approval by hitting aposlikeapos, or explain their negative feelings in the comments. A aposdislikeapos button would lead to less negative, angry comments, Meghan said. One of the things that seems like such an easy solve from my lens,you look at Instagram for example, thereaposs a like button and then thereaposs comments, she said. Soyou disagree with something you have to comment on it in a really vitriolic way. If there was a dislike button wouldnapost that hugely sht what you were putting out there, because you could just like it or just dislike it. Now you have to like it or say something negative. It is just adding to this really unfortunate cycle that I think is having an unfortunate effect on women across the world. The online session tackled the question: How can women reach economic and professional parity    The Duchess argued that pushing for paid parity between the sexes was a positive thing both for workers and for companies, while also renewing her calls for paid sick and parental leave in the US. Earlier this month, the Duchess penned an impassioned plea to senior congress members on the topic. In the letter, she argued that a national paid-leave mandate would not only help inidual families, but the country as a whole. In taking care of your child, you take care of your community, and you take care of your country—because when paid leave is a right, we’re creating a foundation that helps address mental health outcomes, health care costs, and economic strength at the starting line, Meghan wrote.  Paid leave should be a national right, rather than a patchwork option limited to those whose employers have policies in place, or those who live in one of the few states where a leave program exists. … This is about putting families above politics. When she was asked about advocating for the change during the summit this evening, Meghan said she was not involving herself in politics as she considered the issue a cross-party, humanitarian one. The Duchess went on to relate the issue of womenaposs rights in the workplace to her own experience as a child. She spoke about how her experience attempting to save and make money when she was younger has taught her lessons that remain with her today, despite her now sizeable wealth. When she admitted being an avid couponer in her younger years, Meghan was asked whether she keeps up the practice today. Do they have coupons anymore, I donapost know. I will never buy something online without finding an online promo code first, the Duchess said, arguing that values learned as a child can stay with a person for le.  If that was engrained with me when I was young, imagine what the world would be likeyou ingrained other elements of financial understanding, especially in young women, so they could move in the world in a dferent way. Meghan went on to tell how she used to make scrunchies out of scraps of fabric to sell as a child. It was that feeling, I had done something myself, she said of the sensation sheaposd get after selling some of her crafts. You get not just purpose, but a sense of self satisfaction. Meghan also expressed her hopes for the future of work post-Covid, arguing for a hybrid model of working from home and in the flesh for those who can. title: meghan markle feels much better
story: Meghan Markle says she feels much better after Megxit and renouncing royal dutiesMeghan Markle said she is feeling "much better" after renouncing royal duties her first in-person interview since she and Prince Harry revealed all in their bombshell appearance on the Oprah Winfrey showMeghan says her mental health is better now after revealing she experienced suicidal thoughts while pregnantByRyan FaheyReporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle feels much better after admitting she suffered suicidal thoughts while pregnant with son Archie. The Duchess of Sussex discussed a range of issues in her first in-person interview since she and Prince Harryaposs tell all on the Oprah Winfrey show in March. Speaking to host Andrew Ross Sorkin tonight, she said stepping back from royal duties has lead to an improvement in her mental health. Mr Sorkin said there was a moment when a lot of the world was concerned and wondering about the comments she made. The Duchess replied: Iaposm feeling much better about everything, thank you.  In addition to her own mental health, the ex royal spoke of having to cut out coupons as a youngster, her time working as a waitress and her recent controversial letters to Republican Senators on the issue of paid parental leave. Meghan, clad in an all-black outfit, wore a Remembrance poppy as she was questioned for the New York Timesapos DealBook summit. During Prince Harry and Meghanaposs tell-all interview with Oprah Winfrey, which aired on ITV on March , the couple made a series of bombshell revelations about their lives with other royals.During the show - which was broadcast to .million viewers - Meghan claimed there were concerns over their son Archieaposs skin colour. She also claimed that she was denied help from the Royal Family during her private struggle with her suicidal thoughts.Harry also claimed that his father and brother, Prince Charles and William, are trapped in the institution of the monarchy.  And just days ago a royal biographer revealed the interview was planned years in advance. The Sussexesapos rt with the Royal Family led to them moving to the United States last year and since then they have spoken regularly to American media about problems they allege forced them to leave. Allegations or rumours of a dficult relationship between Meghan and other royals were widespread and the relationship deteriorated after their marriage in . While the Sussexes have given regular interviews to the media about their problems with the Royal Family, the one with most impact was made with Oprah earlier this year where Harry said he had to break the cycle and bring his children up in a dferent environment. He was critical of the family while Meghan also alleged a racist incident with a royal who had questioned what colour would be the skin of her child when she was pregnant for the first time.  Now royal biographer Andrew Morton has said that the interview with Oprah was being discussed after Harry and Meghan tied the knot in . In his research for his new book “Meghan and the Unmasking of the Monarchy” he said he was astonished to find that negotiations were underway between Harry and Oprah just six months after they got married.“They were planning the big Oprah interview several years before it actually happened,” he told CTV’s Your Morning.Morton said in the book that he expected the couple to leave the UK for another country for the sake of their marriage as Meghan wasn’t prepared to take any more. “For Harry, it was either Meghan, or the monarchy,” he said in the book. title: meghan markle says never buys
story: Meghan Markle says she never buys anything online without a promo code firstMeghan Markle has told how she is a shrewd shopper who looks out for promo codes and has always had an eye for business having set up her own scrunchies enterprise as a childMeghan has told how she set up a scrunchies business as a child Image: New York Times DealBookByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsMeghan Markle has told how she is a savvy shopper who hunts for promo codes while her entrepreneurial skills saw her sell scrunchies as a youngster. The Duchess of Sussex may now be married to Prince Harry and live in a Calornian mansion but she suggested she remains shrewd with her finances.She told a discussion on women and the gender pay gap that she always had an eye for business and began by making fashion accessories. “I remember when I was really young, I must have been eight or nine, I started making scrunchies to sell,” she told The New York Times DealBook Online Summit.  I had my mum take me downtown to get scraps of fabric from the fabric stores and sell them like five for five bucks who knows.” Meghan said that she can recall the “pride” from making the scrunchies. “I remember the feeling of knowing that I had done something, I had invested in myself and done this labour and been compensated for it. There’s a sense of pride that comes from that,” she said. She is also careful with her money and will hunt out a bargain where possible. Meghan continued: “Do they have coupons anymore  “I don’t know, but I will never buy anything online without finding an online promo code first. That’s still in there, it’s a modern version of the same thing.” Meghan had risen to fame on the set of Suits before she met Harry but she also told the discussion with host Andrew Ross Sorkin and Ariel Investments’ boss Mellody Hobson how she had a series of jobs while she was building her career. She did everything from calligraphy, to gt wrapping and book-binding in her s.  The Duchess told how she was working at the Paper Source store in Beverly Hills, book binding, in -. At the same time she worked as a freelance calligrapher, writing invitations for celebrities Robin Thicke and Paula Patton’s wedding in . She also talked of running the Archewell Foundation with Harry and said that their philosophy was to “treat people the way you want to be treated”. Meanwhile, Mr Sorkin asked about how she was feeling now having talked about mental health concerns in the past. Meghan told an interview with Oprah Winfrey earlier this year, she had suicidal thoughts while a member of the Royal Family living in the UK. She also alleged racism by a royal who asked her what would be the colour of her child when she was pregnant for the first time. She responded to the host that she was now feeling “better about everything”. title: mum describes horrific moment found
story: Mum describes horric moment she found teenager daughter murdered in Chinese takeawayWenjing Lin, , was murdered by Chun Xu, , at the takeaway in Ynyswen, Rhondda Cynon Taf, she lived in with her mother and stepfather, and her mum has described the heartbreaking moment of finding her bodyWenjing Lin, , was murdered by Chun Xu, , at the takeaway she lived in with her mother and stepfather Image: South Wales Police Athena PicturesByKate BuckNews Reporter:,  Nov | commentsA mum has described the horric moment she found her daughteraposs body after she was strangled inside a Chinese takeaway. Wenjing Lin, , was murdered by Chun Xu, , at the takeaway in Ynyswen, Rhondda Cynon Taf, where she lived in with her mother, Meang Xu, and stepfather Yongquan Jiang.Xu had admitted manslaughter but denied murder, but was found guilty of the murder of Miss Linn and the attempted murder of Mr Jiang. Ms Xu has described the horrendous moment she found Miss Lin shortly after the killing on March . She told the court: The moment I saw her face had gone black and pale. I went to hug her and her body was cold. I could see her neck was black as she had been strangled.  Speaking outside the court with the support of her husband, Ms Xu said her daughter had passed all her GCSEaposs with As but died before getting the results. She said: My beautul daughter is gone and I can never forgive you. I have lost my beloved daughter, my everything. Everything of me. She cared for my husband and I very much. She has been helping us to communicate with all the English speakers.school friends miss her so much, I know they are suffering from the pain and loss of their best friend. They will never recover from it. Before that horrible day she was a very, very happy girl. She loved spending time with her friends and she enjoyed school.  Weaposve been to the school to speak to them. My daughter has passed all her GCSEaposs with As but she will never know her results that she has worked so hard for. Iaposm so proud of her achievements in the school. She loved school so much and her teachers called her the model student. Iaposm still not able to comprehend why the perpetrator would do this to her. Our lives have been turned upside down. I was crying every day, watching videos every day and trying to feel close to her and listen to her voice. I cannot imagine what my le is like without her. She was my only child. The perpetrator has broken our family. I had to begin counselling to help me but it will never take away the pain the perpetrator has caused us.  Miss Lin was described as an exceptional student by her teacher Rhiannon Davies who had a statement read to the court during the trial. Ms Davies, who taught Wenjingaposs when she was in year  at Treorchy Comprehensive School, said she was hardworking student. Even on the day of her death I was made aware she had logged in for a maths lesson early in the morning, Ms Davies added. She was a fantastic student and is sorely missed. The trial heard how Xu was a heavy gambler and owed the family £,. Michael Jones QC, prosecuting, told the court Xu visited the family armed with a kitchen kne, and an hour before the attacks had Googled can fingerprints be destroyed by fire.  When he was later questioned by a psychologist about his fitness to be questioned by police, he said: I didnapost mean to hurt the little girl. I wanted revenge on her mother. She upset me on many times and didnapost listen to what I say. Xu, also known as Little Gang, was regarded as a nephew to the mother, Ms Xu, as their parents had lived next door to each other in China, but they were not blood relations, Mr Jones said. In December , the family entrusted Xu with £, that he said he would send back to China for them to pay a friend who had loaned them money to start their business in the UK. However, Xu only sent some of the money back and gambled away £,, which he had then begun paying back. On March , , he rang Ms Xu and askedhe could come to see them, but told her not to tell anyone about his visit. That night they ate food together and everyone went to bed. The next morning, Mr Jones said, he strangled to death -year-old Wenjing. An hour before the attack he is said to have Googled dferent iations of whether finger prints on kne will still existburnt by fire. After killing Wenjing, Xu is said to have lured her stepfather, Mr Jiang, into the basement by asking whether he could have a piece of fish from the freezer. In the basement, Xu began attacking Mr Jiang with two knives, stabbing him in the neck and body.  When Mr Jiang asked Xu why he was attacking him, Xu replied: Money, money, money. Ms Xu then came down the basement stairs and saw the two fighting. She tried to ring a friend, and Xu bit her. Mr Jiang fought Xu off and went upstairs to find his stepdaughter, Wenjing. He discovered her lying on her back by the takeaway counter. Despite attempts by the family and then paramedics to resuscitate the teenager, she was pronounced dead at the scene at .pm. Police found Xu in the kitchen, having cut his own throat. He was treated at University Hospital of Wales before being arrested on suspicion of murder and attempted murder. Xu admitted attacking -year-old Mr Jiang, but denied intending to kill him or cause him serious harm. He will be sentenced on Friday at the same court. title: mum living hotel only kettle
story: Mum living in hotel with only a kettle as mushrooms grow out of ceiling at homeGeorgeianna Matta, , lives with her nine year old daughter in a Travelodge where there is room for a double bed and not much , claiming all their meals need to be cooked using the kettleGeorgeianna and her daughter, Peaches, have been homeless since  due to issues with mould and disrepairByGabriella Clare:,  Nov | comments An Ealing mother has been living in a hotel room for over a month with nothing but a kettle after she claims her oldflat became infested with mould and fungus.Georgeianna Matta, , lives with her nine year old daughter in a Travelodge where there is room for a double bed and not much .She has been homeless since  and has moved ten times since then, and has lived in a number of hotels, one apartment and a refuge.She said: “I’m completely traumatised by this whole thing. The room she’s staying in has a double bed, a plastic chair, a desk and a kettle in.She told MyLondon that she has to wash her and her daughteraposs clothes in the bathroom sink and can only eat Pot Noodles because of the limited facilities.  “I have a nine-year-old daughter and we have to pay for takeaways and cheap food because we have no other option, she said. Georgeianna said there’s no space for any of their belongings in the room and claims her daughter’s school le has been affected dramatically. Each day they are given a breakfast box with a flapjack, cornflakes and a pastry. Issues with disrepair, mould and fungus in her property she claims meant she had to leave her property for both her and her daughteraposs safety. She claimed that her complaints to Housing Association, Catalyst Housing, fell on deaf ears and were ignored.  Georgeianna has now taken her Catalyst Housing to court over their living conditions and a hearing has been set for the end of the month. In , after a year of living in these conditions, both Georgeianna claimed she and her daughter were getting ill and her doctor said it was possible the condition of the house was exacerbating the problem. She said: “We were getting eye infections, ear infections, skin infections and we were constantly going to the doctors and getting prescribed medication. “It got so bad that we would only sleep there, as soon as we woke up in the morning we would run out of the house because we knew it was making us sick and we would come back only to sleep because we had nowhere  to go. “We moved our beds around every room of the house because it was spreading. “Then what I think was fungus started growing and I’ve never seen anything like it in my le. “We used to have to sit and eat with this fungus above us dropping onto us. In the bathroom there was a leak from the extractor fan which meant we couldn’t use the toilet and I’ll be honest with you, we had to go to the toilet in the bath sometimes because it was that bad.” Georgeianna said she complained but the issue wasn’t dealt with properly and claims the mould was scraped back and and painted over. Environmental Health visited the property in November , and issued a Section  to the housing association, identying the property had signicant disrepair and was hazardous to live in. Georgeianna moved into shared accommodation and was then moved a number of times from hotels to flats. After a year of moving around, Catalyst offered her a permanent home to move into but when she went to view the property she claimed she could smell mould, sewage and feared that she would be in the same situation that she had been in previously. She said: Night after night I had no idea where I was going to sleep and I’ve got a nine-year-old daughter who’s caught up in all of this as well.” Georgieanna claims sheaposs been moved over ten times since she was made homeless in . She said: “I’m now being told I need to go back to the property that I was living in in , that made me and my daughter severely ill and I can’t do it, it’s caused me so much trauma and mental health issues. “I don’t want to be in this situation, I just want to live in a property that doesn’t have mould and isn’t going to make me and my daughter ill. “All the properties I’ve been shown are not habitable, I can smell it when I walk in. “It’s heartbreaking, I’ve called my mum and said I can’t do this anymore. Itaposs destroying me and I have no motivation for anything.” The spokesperson said that all accommodation provided by Richmond Council has to meet the Housing Health and Safety Rating System.  A spokesperson from Richmond Council said: Richmond Council has been engaging with this resident and their concern regarding their accommodation. The resident has been provided with temporary accommodation in the borough, but has advised that it is unsuitable and is not living there. The Council has placed the resident in hotel accommodation and is working proactively with the resident to get them out of hotel accommodation and into suitable, alternative temporary accommodation. The case worker met with the resident on November  and we hope to meet a solution soon.A spokesperson for Catalyst said: “Our customers should expect and deserve great customer service and we act as quickly as possible when it comes to damp, mould and other repairs issues but in order to fix them, customers must give us access to do so.“When we attempted to fix the reported issues by Ms Matta she refused to let us into the home or engage with us, forcing us to get a court order to access the property. The repairs were eventually completed over a year ago once we were able to gain access. “Ms Matta is not living in this property so we are attempting to take possession of it to offer it to another family in housing need.” Comment MORE ON TravelodgeCustomer serviceMental healthHomelessness" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum three left no roof
story: Mum-of-three left with no roof at council flat and forced to pee in bucket for weeksThe woman, living in Erith, south east London, said her council-owned flat was in a state of disrepair and her family lived in the cold, with her children crying all the timeA woman hit out at the inhumane conditions at her home after she was left without a roof for three weeks Image: My London BPM MediaByKiro EvansChiara Fiorillo:,  Nov | commentsA mum said she was left with no roof and was forced to pee in a bucket due to construction work at her council flat. The woman, living in Erith, south east London, with her three children, said her family was living in inhumane conditions. She criticised Bexley Council after urgent building work to fix the chimney stack in her home meant scaffolding was used to replace the roof in September. The repairs also affected the plumbing system in the property, so the family had to use a bucket instead of the toilet.The mum also claimed the property was infested with mice, My London reports.Do you have a nightmare housing story  Email webnews@mirror  She said her family felt cold and her children were always in tears, but she refused an alternative offer of a hostel because of safety fears. Pictures of the home show scaffolding and plastic sheets were used in place of the removed roof. The work had to be carried out urgently after surveyors discovered a structural issue caused by dry rot. She told the Local Democracy Reporting Service: The flat was in a state of disrepair and there was no end of problems. My youngest daughter used to just cry. She really didnapost like it. It was not liveable. Everything was water damaged. Itaposs an absolute state. The wind was just blowing through, they didnapost secure the plastic, so it was completely open. She added: This was a multi-agency failure. And the fact that in this day children could be treated in this way is actually disgusting. The fact that my children had to go through what they went through is horrendous. Her three children, all aged eight and under, have since spent time with relatives outside the capital, but she says the ordeal has disrupted their schooling and affected their behaviour. She has since moved after opposition councillors stepped in, but said the issue left her unable to explain to her children why their home was so bad. The mum said: To be honest, I thought aposhow has it come to this apos My kids were crying and I had no answers for them. I canapost even give them their basic needs in le and itaposs an absolutely horrendous feeling. And going to the toilet in a bucket was just inhumane. She is set toto the property later this month once repairs are finished. Labour councillor Nicola Taylor, who became directly involved in the case after Mary visited her constituency office, said: I was shocked when I saw the state of this property and knew we had to get the family to a place of safety immediately. As I have become more involved in this case, I have serious concerns over the quality of these properties andthey are fit for our residents. I have still been unable to obtain surveyor or maintenance reports so I wondercouncil taxpayersapos money is being spent appropriately. Bexley Council said in a statement sent to The Mirror: The welfare of people we place in temporary accommodation is a priority for us and we work hard to ensure their safety. The extent of the repairs to this property only became evident following a leak, inspection by our staff and after a ceiling was removed. We identied the work that would be needed and offered the family alternative accommodation while it was carried out. They have a right to their privacy and we are not prepared to publicly share further details of their case. title: new mum 46 diagnosed incurable
story: New mum, , diagnosed with incurable cancer  weeks after giving birth to baby girlAndrea Kevill-Davies pain was first thought to be kidney stones but the shadows on her bladder turned out to be tumours - her family and friends have now rallied round to support herAndrea Kevill-Davies and her eldest son Connor as she has been diagnosed with cancerByEden LewisAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | commentsA new mum was diagnosed with incurable cancer six weeks after giving birth. Andrea Kevill-Daviesapos ongoing pain was first thought to be kidney stones and treatment was deemed too dangerous while she was carrying daughter Daisy. Heartbreakingly, the shadows on the mumaposs bladder turned out to be tumours. Diane Spooner, the -year-oldaposs sister-in-law, said the diagnosis was devastating.The -year-old told TeesideLive : The decision was made to deliver her baby as quickly as possible so she could have a biopsy.Daisy was born on September  this year and Andrea underwent a biopsy just after Daisy was born with Down Syndrome.  As a childminder Andrea knew exactly how to care for her new daughter as she had past experience with children sheaposd looked after. The news also came a week after Andrea buried her father-in-lawA GoFundMe has been created by her friends to help raise money for the family.Diane added: Andrea Whatsapped me last Wednesday saying it wasnapost good news and she was finding out more. She messaged half an hour later saying she had incurable cancer and was starting chemotherapy immediately. Itaposs just devastating, we only buried my father-in-law the week before and now this. Sheaposs had to pack in her job as a childminder whilst she has her treatment and I hope to care for her as much as I did when I was caring for my father-in-law. Andreaaposs eldest son Connor was stationed in Cyprus in the army and has now left so he can help with his Mam and the family.for our daily newsletter to keep up to date with all the essential information atwww.mirror email . Despite how heartbreaking it is, the support from the community has been breathtaking as they help raise some funds for Andrea and her family. Sheaposs the loveliest person in the world, sheaposs absolutely amazing and I hope this money can help her create some memories with her family. title: our marriage open because danny
story: Exclusive: We opened our marriage because Danny Dyers right - its cruel to have sex with  personPolyamorous husband and we Paulina and Daniel Tenner say comments made by Eastenders actor Danny Dyer about having sex with the same person forever is cruel really resonateOpen marriage couple Paulina and Daniel Tenner at home in Hoxton Image: TIM ANDERSONByClaire OBoyle:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments Maybe it’s what a lot of married people think and never say. But EastEnders star Danny Dyer - being Danny Dyer - said it aloud last week. He reckons it’s cruel to have sex with just one person forever. So the hardman actor, who is married to his childhood sweetheart Jo Mas, will be green with envy at the lestyle of husband and we Paulina and Daniel Tenner. They’ve been married for eight years... and almost four years ago decided to “open” their marriage and have sex with other people. “If someone had asked me about this a few years back I’d never have thought I’d do it,” says Paulina, . “But that all changed as a result of some workshops I did about relationships, and I realised my sexual le force was blossoming.” It was then the entrepreneur and husband Daniel, , started talking about how an open marriage might work for them.What is your view on open marriages  Have your say in the comment section “For years we’d been monogamous,” says Paulina, who lives with Daniel in London. “But suddenly I was feeling attracted to dferent men, dferent women, everyone. In the early days of discussions, I may have been the driving force for this, but Daniel definitely needed to be on board - and he was. I wouldn’t have done it without us both feeling the same way.” After long discussions with her husband, Paulina started off at parties with other women that allowed her to “explore her bi-curious fantasies” while Daniel also started seeing other women. He says: “We had talked a lot before we made our decision, and we’d come to the same conclusion. Part of the purpose of le is to really feel that you’re alive and to explore all the interesting things in the world. One of the most fascinating things is the relationships we have with other people. To cut off any of these avenues means you’re sacricing an important part of your le, a part you could derive a huge amount of joy from. “That’s why the comments from Danny Dyer really resonate, because you’re cutting things off, you’re cutting off amazing things that you might have discovered through a connectionyou don’t explore it.”  Over two years the couple each had a series of lovers. Paulina connected with both men and women, and Daniel just dated women. Paulina thinks she had around  partners, while Daniel says he’s not interested in keeping count. “To me, counting lovers is a feature of monogamous le, when there’s pressure, especially on men, to have this sort of ego boost from having a large number of lovers,” he says. “It isn’t something I’m interested in.” The pair spent one New Year’s Eve together with their separate partners - Paulina with her Norwegian boyfriend, while Daniel came along with the British woman he was seeing at the time. “We felt like a big, polyamorous family,” says Paulina. “It was so natural and normal. I was with my lover, and Daniel was with the woman he was seeing at the time, a lady I was good friends with. It was lovely, flowing and natural.”  On seeing her husband with another partner Paulina says: “There was no jealousy. In fact there was satisfaction that he was experiencing something new and interesting. We have no secrets and our relationship is wonderfully transparent.” Daniel agrees jealousy is not a factor. “The idea Paulina is have a wonderful experience with someone  does not create jealousy,” he says. “Jealousy is a term that lumps together a bunch of other things, usually the fear of losing the other person and an envy of what they’ve got. But I haven’t felt a fear of losing Paulina to her other lovers, and I was being nourished and getting what I wanted too, so envy didn’t arise either.” Paulina, who has written a book after training in burlesque dancing, Laid Bare: What the Business Leader Learnt From the Stripper, says she built some deep connections with other partners, particularly the Norwegian man she dated for around two years in parallel with her marriage. She says while maintaining more than one relationship at a time might sound like a lot of effort, the newness of having dferent partners is “exciting”. “I actually think online dating sounds way more exhausting,” she laughs. “Just sex with no emotions is not very interesting to me,” adds Paulina. “Of course I get that people want to want to have just have sex, and that’s fine, but for Daniel and I, we’re looking for more depth. OK, it won’t be as deep a connection as we have with each other, but it needs to be more than just friends with benefits. There has to be a real connection for the sex to be worth it.”  Daniel says having other lovers actually brought him closer to his we. “Encounters with other people have been enjoyable,” he says. “But they also made me realise, even as the connections grew deeper with some women, they led me back to my we.” And while the couple enjoyed their two years in an open relationship, just before the lockdown was announced in early  they decided to suspend the open nature of their marriage - although at the minute they are considering opening it up once again. Pauline says: “At the minute we’re just together but it’s something we might come back to as it gave us so much joy and pleasure, as long as we protect the space for ourselves too.” Daniel adds: “I might be a step further towards opening up again than Paulina is. I don’t want to get to the end of my le and think I had all these opportunities to explore connections and didn’t take them.” The couple, who have been attending couples therapy for more than a year, are considering having children in the future. They have not yet decidedthey would follow the open marriage model while having a family, although Daniel thinks this would offer an open-minded and healthy example to any children. Paulina adds: “We think so many people would be happierthey knew polyamory was a valid option for them. We think there would be less cheating and fewer hearts would be brokenother couples were open about wanting about to make other connections in their le and decided to follow those connections with openness and honesty.”Laid Bare: What The Business Leader Learnt From the Stripper, by Paulina Tenner is out on November . Preorder at www.paulinatenner Comment MORE ON Danny DyerRelationshipsMarriageWeird sex" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: pent up frustration came pouring
story: Pent-up frustration came pouring out as Brits entered US following Covid travel banHours early, and on board BA’s flight, there was a chorus of applause as it, and Virgin Atlantic’s jet took to the skies together in a first for two commercial servicesA party atmosphere greeted those arriving in New York from BritainopinionByGraham HiscottHead of Business:,  Nov | commentsA party atmosphere greeted those arriving in New York from Britain yesterday - with the Daily Mirror among the very first passengers to step through the doors.But the colourful balloons and cheers could not disguise the seriousness of what had come before during  long months of separation for so many families.For during that time there have been missed birthdays, Christmas get-togethers, weddings and, sadly, funerals. Hours early, and on board BA’s flight, there was a chorus of applause as it, and Virgin Atlantic’s jet took to the skies together in a first for two commercial services.You could also hear the palpable sigh of relief from the airline bigwigs present that this moment had arrived, and with it their hope will make a fightback from what has driven other competitors to the wall.  It is also important for those businesses that can finally meet others face-to-face. And it is a big day for tourism chiefs in the Big Apple banking on aof the big spending British shoppers. But yesterday was never really about the firms involved, it was about the iniduals on board - and those who have rushed to book flights - counting down the hours, the day the weeks until they can embrace precious loved ones again. Any video call will never, ever, make up for the emotions witnessed at JFK’s arrivals hall yesterday, when  months or more of pent-up sadness, frustration and finally relief came pouring out. title: professions covid vaccine full list
story: Which professions have to have the Covid vaccine  Full list and exemptionsThe government is set to make Covid vaccines mandatory for all frontline workers. Here’s everything we need to know including the full list of professions considered as frontline staffThe health minister believes that making jabs mandatory will drive up vaccination rates Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByMalvika Padin:,  Nov Updated:,  Nov | comments All frontline NHS staff and social care workers in England will be required to get both doses of the Covid- vaccines from April  next year.Health Secretary Sajid Javid has announced the move to make vaccines mandatory for frontline workers, with those of the , frontline personnel who have not yet had both doses of Covid vaccine will have to get jabbed or face dismissal.Previously, Justice Secretary and Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab refused to comment on the reports, but told BBC Breakfast that the government has been “very mindful of encouraging greater take-up – or maximum take-upyou like – of the vaccination and the boosters,” particularly in vulnerable settings like care homes and NHS.  NHS Providers chief executive Chris Hopson told BBC Radio  thatdone right, the decision could drive take-up of the vaccines up .Here’s who be will impacted by the move to make vaccines mandatory. Who will the mandatory vaccination rule apply to  Frontline staff usually means staff that work directly with the public, rather than behind closed doors or in a support capacity.  This would include:doctors nurses midwives paramedics pharmacists social workers and care workersThe only people exempt from the mandatory policy will be those who do not have to face contact with patients and those who have a medical exemption. How many NHS workers do not have the jab  While care groups have been calling for the mandatory vaccine policy to be axed or delayed so providers can get through winter challenges without more staff leaving, the rule that they have to be immunised by this Friday or risk losing their job has seen many care workers who initially refused the vaccine, take the immunisation.  The health minister believes that, while some NHS staff may leave, making jabs mandatory will drive up vaccination rates by prompting those who have been refusing to finally get vaccinated in the same way that has already occurred with care home staff. According to latest NHS figures, almost a quarter of the care home staff were not recorded as having been double jabbed as of October , which means they might lose their jobs this week. Three-quarters of staff working in other social care settings outside of care homes, including non-registered providers and those employed by local authorities, have had their first jab. But only a third of them were doubled jabbed, with many having self-certied as exempt or applied for official proof.
